junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:

>>  > 'Faulty or imperfect design'- well thatz not the case when we  >
>> can't use jUnit for this purpose.
> 
> I mean, let us not conclude that it is faulty or imperfect
> design just because we cannot use jUnit framework in this case.

First, I'd say that "cannot use Junit" is to strong a statement. You just
cannot use it the way you expected. Object Mother is a well accepted, if
seldom used, pattern in the Junit community, as far as I can tell.

Second, I don't conclude anything here. It's just that I *strongly suspect*
any design that is hard to unit test to be improvable, not only out of
experience, but also because it seems to me that a well decoupled system
must be easy to unit test, almost by definition.

If you should ever feel like discussing those design issues in more detail,
you know where you can find me... ;)

Cheers, Ilja
